title: Priori Acute
content:
Well... what do you all think? Priori Acute is a new addition to the Priori family. I have a client I'd like to create a logo with it for...

I love it and it fits their business perfectly,just curious about your thoughts on the font itself?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [priori\_acute.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013185124/http:/typophile.com/files/priori_acute.jpg) | 261.2 KB |
author: cdunitz

comments.content:
Very cool.  
When did this come out?

The only issue you might have in a logo is the gaps. If/when the logo is small enough they'll become noise - so might need to -carefully!- enlarge them.

hhp

Weird, I also came across this font last week!  
I find the 3D contours of B and left-hand R a bit problematic. Something not right to my eye.

<cite>I find the 3D contours of B and left-hand R a bit problematic. Something not right to my eye.</cite>

It's not your eye. It's M.C. Escher! ;-)
Wow, this is great stuff. Now I want it too.

Not use how recently it came out, I stumbled upon it searching for a look for this particular client.

Yes, I think the contours so make you think a bit, which can be good or bad - depending on who's doing the looking I suppose.

But I seriously have the hots for it and if the client doesn't go with it, I'll have to figure out some other way to use it.
